verses.verse: Now Shephatiah<WH8203> the son<WH1121> of Mattan,<WH4977> and Gedaliah<WH9072> the son<WH1121> of Pashhur,<WH6583> and Jucal<WH3081> the son<WH1121> of Shelemiah,<WH8018> and Pashhur<WH6583> the son<WH1121> of Malchijah<WH4441> heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> that Jeremiah<WH3414> was speaking<WH1696> to all<WH3605> the people,<WH5971> saying,<WH559>

"Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> 'He who stays<WH3427> in this<WH384> city<WH5892> will die<WH4191> by the sword<WH2719> and by famine<WH7458> and by pestilence,<WH1698> but he who goes<WH3318> out to the Chaldeans<WH3778> will live<WH2421> and have<WH1961> his [own] life<WH5315> as booty<WH7998> and stay<WH2421> alive.<WH2421>'

"Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> 'This<WH384> city<WH5892> will certainly<WH5414> be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the army<WH2428> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> and he will capture<WH3920> it.'"

Then the officials<WH8269> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "Now<WH4994> let this<WH2088> man<WH376> be put<WH4191> to death,<WH4191> inasmuch<WH3588> <WH5921> <WH3651> as he is discouraging<WH7503> <WH3027> the men<WH376> of war<WH4421> who are left<WH7604> in this<WH384> city<WH5892> and all<WH3605> the people,<WH5971> by speaking<WH1696> such<WH428> words<WH1697> to them; for this<WH2088> man<WH376> is not seeking<WH1875> the well-being of this<WH2088> people,<WH5971> but rather<WH3588> <WH518> their harm.<WH9567>"
So King<WH4428> Zedekiah<WH6667> said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2009> he is in your hands;<WH3027> for the king<WH4428> can<WH3201> [do] nothing<WH369> <WH1697> against you."

Then they took<WH3947> Jeremiah<WH3414> and cast<WH7993> him into the cistern<WH953> [of] Malchijah<WH4441> the king's son,<WH1121> which<WH834> was in the court<WH2691> of the guardhouse;<WH4307> and they let<WH7971> Jeremiah<WH3414> down<WH7971> with ropes.<WH9112> Now in the cistern<WH953> there<WH369> was no<WH369> water<WH4325> but only<WH518> mud,<WH2916> and Jeremiah<WH3414> sank<WH2883> into the mud.<WH2916>

But Ebed-melech the Ethiopian,<WH3569> a eunuch,<WH5631> while he was in the king<WH4428>'s palace,<WH1004> heard<WH8085> that they had put<WH5414> Jeremiah<WH3414> into the cistern.<WH953> Now the king was sitting<WH3427> in the Gate<WH8179> of Benjamin;<WH1144>
and Ebed-melech went<WH3318> out from the king<WH4428>'s palace<WH1004> and spoke<WH1696> to the king, saying,<WH559>

"My lord<WH113> the king,<WH4428> these<WH428> men<WH376> have acted<WH7489> wickedly<WH7489> in all<WH3605> that they have done<WH6213> to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> whom<WH834> they have cast<WH7993> into the cistern;<WH953> and he will die<WH4191> right<WH8478> where<WH8478> he is because<WH4480> <WH6440> of the famine,<WH7458> for there<WH369> is no<WH369> more<WH5750> bread<WH3899> in the city.<WH5892>"

Then the king<WH4428> commanded<WH6680> Ebed-melech the Ethiopian,<WH3569> saying,<WH559> "Take<WH3947> thirty<WH7970> men<WH376> from here<WH2088> under your authority,<WH3027> and bring<WH5927> up Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> from the cistern<WH953> before<WH2962> he dies.<WH4191>"

So Ebed-melech took<WH3947> the men<WH376> under his authority<WH3027> and went<WH935> into the king's palace<WH1004> to [a place] beneath<WH8478> the storeroom<WH214> and took<WH3947> from there<WH8033> worn-out clothes<WH5499> and worn-out rags<WH4418> and let<WH7971> them down<WH7971> by ropes<WH9112> into the cistern<WH953> to Jeremiah.<WH3414>

Then Ebed-melech the Ethiopian<WH3569> said<WH559> to Jeremiah,<WH3414> "Now<WH4994> put<WH7760> these worn-out clothes<WH5499> and rags<WH4418> under<WH8478> your armpits<WH679> <WH3027> under<WH8478> the ropes<WH9112>"; and Jeremiah<WH3414> did<WH6213> so.<WH3651>
So they pulled<WH4900> Jeremiah<WH3414> up with the ropes<WH9112> and lifted<WH5927> him out of the cistern,<WH953> and Jeremiah<WH3414> stayed<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the guardhouse.<WH4307>

Then King<WH4428> Zedekiah<WH6667> sent<WH7971> and had Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> brought<WH3947> to him at the third<WH7992> entrance<WH3996> that is in the house<WH1004> of the Lord;<WH3068> and the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Jeremiah,<WH3414> "I am going to ask<WH7592> you something;<WH1697> do not hide<WH3582> anything<WH1697> from me."

Then Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559> to Zedekiah,<WH6667> "If<WH3588> I tell<WH5046> you, will you not certainly<WH4191> put<WH4191> me to death<WH4191>? Besides, if<WH3588> I give<WH3289> you advice,<WH3289> you will not listen<WH8085> to me."

But King<WH4428> Zedekiah<WH6667> swore<WH7650> to Jeremiah<WH3414> in secret<WH5643> saying,<WH559> "As the Lord<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> who<WH834> made<WH6213> this<WH384> life<WH5315> for us, surely<WH518> I will not put<WH4191> you to death<WH4191> nor<WH518> will I give<WH5414> you over to the hand<WH3027> of these<WH428> men<WH376> who<WH834> are seeking<WH1245> your life.<WH5315>"

Then Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559> to Zedekiah,<WH6667> "Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts,<WH6635> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> 'If<WH518> you will indeed<WH3318> go<WH3318> out to the officers<WH8269> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> then you will live,<WH2421> this<WH384> city<WH5892> will not be burned<WH8313> with fire,<WH784> and you and your household<WH1004> will survive.<WH2421>

'But if<WH518> you will not go<WH3318> out to the officers<WH8269> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> then this<WH384> city<WH5892> will be given<WH5414> over to the hand<WH3027> of the Chaldeans;<WH3778> and they will burn<WH8313> it with fire,<WH784> and you yourself<WH859> will not escape<WH4422> from their hand.<WH3027>' "

Then King<WH4428> Zedekiah<WH6667> said<WH559> to Jeremiah,<WH3414> "I dread<WH1672> the Jews<WH3064> who<WH834> have gone<WH5307> over<WH5307> to the Chaldeans,<WH3778> lest<WH6435> they give<WH5414> me over into their hand<WH3027> and they abuse<WH9412> me."

But Jeremiah<WH3414> said,<WH559> "They will not give<WH5414> you over. Please<WH4994> obey<WH8085> <WH6963> the Lord<WH3068> in what<WH834> I am saying<WH1696> to you, that it may go<WH3190> well<WH3190> with you and you may live.<WH2421>
"But if<WH518> you keep refusing<WH3985> to go<WH3318> out, this<WH2088> is the word<WH1697> which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> has shown<WH7200> me:

'Then behold,<WH2009> all<WH3605> of the women<WH802> who<WH834> have been left<WH7604> in the palace<WH1004> of the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> are going to be brought<WH3318> out to the officers<WH8269> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon;<WH894> and those<WH1992> women<WH1992> will say,<WH559> "Your close<WH7965> friends<WH376> <WH7965> Have misled<WH5496> and overpowered<WH3201> you; While your feet<WH7272> were sunk<WH2883> in the mire,<WH1206> They turned<WH5472> back.<WH268>"

'They will also bring<WH3318> out all<WH3605> your wives<WH802> and your sons<WH1121> to the Chaldeans,<WH3778> and you yourself<WH859> will not escape<WH4422> from their hand,<WH3027> but will be seized<WH8610> by the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> and this<WH384> city<WH5892> will be burned<WH8313> with fire.<WH784>' "
Then Zedekiah<WH6667> said<WH559> to Jeremiah,<WH3414> "Let no<WH408> man<WH376> know<WH3045> about these<WH428> words<WH1697> and you will not die.<WH4191>

"But if<WH3588> the officials<WH8269> hear<WH8085> that I have talked<WH1696> with you and come<WH935> to you and say<WH559> to you, 'Tell<WH5046> us now<WH4994> what<WH4100> you said<WH1696> to the king,<WH4428> and what<WH4100> the king<WH4428> said<WH1696> to you; do not hide<WH3582> [it] from us, and we will not put<WH4191> you to death,<WH4191>'

then you are to say<WH559> to them, 'I was presenting<WH5307> my petition<WH8467> before<WH6440> the king,<WH4428> not to make me return<WH7725> to the house<WH1004> of Jonathan<WH3083> to die<WH4191> there.<WH8033>' "

Then all<WH3605> the officials<WH8269> came<WH935> to Jeremiah<WH3414> and questioned<WH7592> him. So he reported<WH5046> to them in accordance with all<WH3605> these<WH428> words<WH1697> which<WH834> the king<WH4428> had commanded;<WH6680> and they ceased<WH2790> speaking<WH2790> with him, since<WH3588> the conversation<WH1697> had not been overheard.<WH8085>
So Jeremiah<WH3414> stayed<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the guardhouse<WH4307> until<WH5704> the day<WH3117> that Jerusalem<WH3389> was captured.<WH3920>
